sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has been hit with a large-scale wave of Russian strikes on the eve of Russia's victory day anniversary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Rebel Syrians slam the Arab League's decision to readmit their country to the group, calling it a whitewash of President Assad's regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Britain's coronation weekend continues after a star-studded concert Sunday night with a Monday dedicated to volunteering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Five people have been injured in Ukraine's capital Kiev after a wave of Russian strikes ahead of Moscow's Victory Day parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It comes as Ukraine's special operations forces accuse Russia of using phosphorus shells in Bakhmut. This video purports to show the telltale white fire from such munitions falling in the city. On the ground, heavy fighting for Bakhmut intensified on the eve of Victory Day celebrations in Russia. Ukrainian soldiers appear to spend most of the time in bunkers taking cover from the Russian shelling. Meanwhile Russia has sparked a mad panic after telling people to evacuate 18 settlements in the region surrounding the contested Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. The mayor of Melitopol said on Sunday there were five-hour waits as thousands of cars left the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN's nuclear watchdog, Rafael Grossi, has warned a severe nuclear accident could occur. Grossi, who recently visited the plant, says the evacuation indicates the possibility of heavy fighting between Russian and Ukrainian forces around the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: between Russian and Ukrainian forces around the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Russia is preparing for its annual Victory Day celebrations amid rising concern about domestic security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin usually uses the day, which celebrates the Soviet Union's World War II victory over Nazi Germany, to evoke patriotism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But this year, people are focusing on a series of drone strikes and sabotage operations. Russia has blamed Ukraine and its Western supporters for attacks within its borders, including an alleged drone attack on the Kremlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, a car explosion injured a pro-Kremlin rider.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Political uncertainty in Slovakia as its caretaker prime minister stepped down after a string of ministerial resignations over the past week,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: potentially paving the way for a pro-Moscow party to take power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The country's president has since appointed a top banker to lead a technocrat government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Slovakia will have a general election in September, and polls suggest that voters are leaning towards the pro-Russia Samir-SD party, which is against sending military support to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A farmer plowing his field in Ukraine. Those in areas that are now free from Russian occupation

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: are risking their lives to clear their land of explosives ahead of the critical spring planting season. Even then, they must cope with soaring production and transportation costs caused by Moscow's blockade of many Black Sea ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He is a one-man bandit. He is at his own risk. He is putting himself at risk. He goes to the field, takes out the goods, and thenиваються. Бо хочуть обробити землю, тому що вони за щось в землі живуть.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Прошлий рік урожай не зібрали, не посіялися зимами, зараз семечкою не оціюються, соєчником, опять остануться.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Тобто остануться без грошей зовсім. У нас ситуація така, що ми арендоване підприємство, у нас робочі.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Робочих послати на поле, на якому ми знаємо, є міни, заряди, я не можу. Like many other farmers across Ukraine, Ushkalo says his risk of going bankrupt is very real.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A decision by the Arab League to readmit Syria to their ranks after being suspended for more

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: than a decade has been slammed by the US, the UK and rebel Syrians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Foreign ministers from 13 of the 22 nation groups members were present at the meeting in Cairo where the decision to readmit Syria was taken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They stressed the need to end Syria's civil war and the resulting refugee and drug smuggling crises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But Syrians living in the rebel-held northern province of Idlib have voiced shock, accusing Arab countries of whitewashing President Bashar al-Assad's regime and questioning their fate following the decision. ويقوم بمحاولة تحديد رجيم بشار الأسد ويقوم بمحاتل وغسل يديه من دمائنا نحن لم نستفد منه عند المكان في الجامعة العربية وعند الصار في الجامعة العربية نحن الآن مهجرين ونخرج من بلادنا وبر بلادنا لا يفيدنا كل هذا الحكي لأنهم لو لم يردوا على الجامعة العربية حتى كلها لبعضهم لا يوجد إفادة منهم تماما سيريا's Arab League membership was revoked after President Bashar al-Assad ordered a crackdown on protesters in March 2011 that spiraled the country into a civil war that has since killed nearly half a million people and displaced another 23 million The US and UK are among the Western countries that have recently stated they won't restore relations with President Assad's government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Incumbent president and presidential candidate of the People's Alliance, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, held a massive rally in Istanbul on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to official figures, more than 1.7 milyon insanın katıldığı için, Rally'in katıldığı için, AK Partisi'nin 20 yıllık güçlü bir kandida katıldığı için, onur olduğu için ve bir de hizmet aşkı var. Vatanını, dinini, Allah'ını seven bir lider.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Geçmişimi bildiğim için Tayyip Erdoğan'ın yolunda ilerlemek istediğim için Tayyip Erdoğan her zaman Tayyip Erdoğan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Erdoğan'ı ödemeye, Kiliçdarolu'nun bir çatışma ve terörist organizasyonlarıyla ilerleyen bir kandidati kandidati. During the rally, Erdogan attacked opposition candidate Kemal Kilic Daroglu, claiming he was a drunk and that he was collaborating with terrorist organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The May 14th parliamentary and presidential elections may prove to be Erdogan's toughest yet, as latest polls have him lagging behind his opponent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Eight people have died after an SUV slammed into a crowd at a bus stop in the U.S. state of Texas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Another 10 people were injured in the incident outside a migrant shelter in the border city of Bronzeville.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Police say it's not clear whether the event on Sunday was intentional, an accident, or the result of intoxication.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The driver has been arrested and taken to the hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Bronzeville is the epicenter for migration across the U.S.-Mexico border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This, as the state is reeling from a weekend shooting at a shopping mall, which left eight dead, including several children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: More than 29,000 people in the Canadian state of Alberta have been forced out of their communities

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: as wildfires continue to burn across the province on Sunday. There are currently a hundred and ten active wildfires, 37 of which are considered out of control. On Saturday the provincial government declared a state of emergency saying the hot and dry weather favored the start of the blazes which have so far burned 122 000 hectares of forest a day after a gilded coronation ceremony watched by millions king charles and queen camilla let

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: others take the center stage as they took in the star-studded entertainment featuring Nigerian singer Tiwa Savage, American pop icon Katy Perry and many others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But then it was the turn of Prince William, Prince of Wales, to compliment his father and the people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: his father and the people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Pa, we are all so proud of you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And I also want to express my pride and gratitude for the millions of people who serve in the forces, in classrooms, hospital wards, and local communities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I wish I could mention you all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Your service inspires us and tonight we celebrate you too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The extended coronation weekend continues for Brits today with what's being called the Big Help Out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The aim is to use volunteering to bring communities together and create a lasting community service legacy stemming from the historic occasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: As the climate crisis pushes global temperatures higher, big cities are feeling the heat with thermometer readings twice as high as rural areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The combination of air conditioning, traffic buildup and the lack of fountains or green corridors means cities can be a heat trap for the most vulnerable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So how can we make our cities cooler quickly. How do we design our public spaces and how do we make sure that the buildings have, are better insulated, thermally insulated to protect the people inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But generally bringing temperatures down in cities by using special types of materials and technologies, but also nature, nature, nature, nature and water in the surface to bring temperatures down. We should keep air conditioning like medicine, giving it to people when they really need it and really keeping it at minimum use.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Any delay in implementing measures would risk aggravating the situation further.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Professor Harriet Buckley, urban warming expert, advocates immediate action. The first thing, keep what we've got. And the second thing is to try to introduce more nature and blue areas into cities. And a lot of our tarmac in cities is also very dark. And the more darker surfaces that we have in cities, the more heat they will absorb. We could start by just painting our roofs white. That could be in the form of green walls, green roofs, small street parks, shaded trees. We can think about de-paving, so removing some of the pavement that we have in our cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Actually introducing blue areas into cities can be a bit faster than growing the nature that we need in cities to support us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Some cities have successfully implemented measures such as Malmo, Paris, Milan, Barcelona or Lisbon. But experts warn against the danger of inaction by governments. Adding scientific research has identified the main factors contributing to global warming in cities.
